                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        Credit: 04(T) + 02 (P) Total learning hours: 60
Course description:\rThis course will provide the student with an introduction to the concepts and technologies of the\rprincipal manufacturing processes utilized by industry. Subjects include the manufacturing system\rand its operating principles, and advanced manufacturing processes, industrial effluent treatment,\rsolid and hazardous waste management. Course provides the idea about quality control and quality\rmanagement and safety in chemical industries.                      NaN

Program: M.Sc. Organic Chemistry Type: Theory
                                                                                   Semester: I
                                                   Subject:SEC I:ADVANCED ANALYTICAL CHEMISTRY
                                                Credit:04(T) + 02 (P) Total learning hours: 60
                                                                           Course description:
This Course Paper proposes to teach about: Analytical chemistry basic principles and classical
     theory, sampling methods, various volumetric analysis, gravimetric analysis and about the
                             reliability of analytical data generated in a statistical manner.
                                                                     Student learning outcome:
                                    At the end of the course students will be able to... Learn
                            • The quantitative and qualitative aspects of analytical chemistry
                                                                         • Sampling techniques
                                               • Principle, method of gravimetric analysis and
                                                   • Principle, method of volumetric analysis:
 • Acid-base titrations, precipitation titrations, redox titrations, complexometric titrations
                   • Statistical methods to check the reliability of generated analytical data
                                                              • Applications in various fields

Course description:\rThis course presents concise and relevant information on the composition of foods and the reactions\rthey undergo during processing and storage.  The course will deal with the chemistry of the\rprincipal components of foods, their properties and interactions. This will provide basic information\rregarding the food analysis also.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             his course presents concise and relevant information on the composition of foods and the reactions
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     hey undergo during processing and storage.

Student learning outcome:\rAt the end of the course students will be able to:\r•\rExplain the importance of water for stability and quality of foods.\r•\rUnderstand the relationship between nutrition and human well being\r•\rKnow the major and minor components of foods\r•\rKnow composition and properties of food\r•\rExplain the basic structures of food constituents\r•\rUnderstand the basic chemical reaction food constituents undergo during processing\r•\rIdentify additives added to foods for different purposes                      NaN
